page.title: 08HOME FARM,BAGENDON.
page.content: Home farm in Bagendon is about 100 years old it is owned by Mr and Mrs Bovil. They have 40 acres of grassland and keep about 10 cows, 13 calves and 5 horses. The farm has 2 tractors and about 12 farm implements. The calves are bought at{Gloucester cattle market and sold when they are 9 months old. Suckling cows are kept to serve the calves, milk is not sold. The cows have one calf each year, these are kept on the farm either to be sold for beef if it's a bull calf or for milking if it's female. In the future the Bovils would like to move to a bigger farm where they can keep more cattle.
